name: Fairfield Inn & Suites State College

reviews.text: I arrived with a large group at 10:30am for check-in. They said they they were not ready and we'd have to check in at the normal time (3pm). OK. So we went to lunch and did a few things and arrived at 3:45pm to find that our rooms were STILL not ready - though they knew we had been waiting since 10:30am. So slightly disappointing that they couldn't even have the rooms ready when they KNEW we were waiting! But, they were great in getting us all on the same floor in the same section. The hotel was clean and the front desk was very polite and friendly. The rooms were a standard for a Fairfield but I have to admit CLEANER. It is strange, but I always like to look at the returns in the room and bathroom and shower to see how dusty they are for overall cleanliness - these were pristine!! Probably one of the cleanest hotels I've ever stayed in!! I would stay there again based on the price point, cleanliness, staff energy etc. Just be prepared to wait when it comes to checking-in as they are very laid back attitude - think southern slow.
reviews.title: Nice overall experience

reviews.text: The hotel was clean and up to date. Room was clean and bed was comfortable. Nice pool. Good breakfast. There is a restaurant/pub right in front of the hotel. There is a shopping center with a Wegmans down the street. Overall a good stay.
reviews.title: Good hotel to stay at for a business traveller

reviews.text: No blankets, terrible towels. The one person staffing the hotel is very nice. Would I stay here again? Not if there were better options. But the price sure is right! The location is extremely convenient to Penn State and shopping.
reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For

reviews.text: With the Fairfield Inn, you get what you pay for - no surprises here. A nice and tidy room, breakfast included, wifi included (faster than what I have at home!), and a nice gym/pool. Only downside to this location of the hotel is the lack of restaurants nearby. The only place to eat was a brew pub next door that was average. If you're just passing through, it's fine though.
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay for a night

reviews.text: We were in State College to tour PSU. I have stayed at many Fairfields, and this one was typical. It was clean, new and bright with a very pleasant and helpful staff. Our room and beds were clean and comfortable. The bathroom was a good size. It was decent location, with easy access to the campus, down town and main roads. The free breakfast is great. it had hot items as well as toast, cereal, fruit and yogurt. We were on the first floor, but it was still quiet and we got a great night's sleep. I have never had a bad stay at a Fairfield. This place is a good value for the money.
reviews.title: Love Fairfield Inn

reviews.text: Great place to stay football weekends.Super clean, quiet. They free breakfast in the am is actually good. And its right next to Otto's microbrewery, so you can come back from the game, park, and go right next door, avoiding the craziness of town.
reviews.title: Clean, nice breakfast, right next to Otto's!

reviews.text: Stayed here for a football weekend in November. I wasn't sure what to expect from a Fairfield Inn, but was very pleasantly surprised. The hotel is new so all the furnishings were very nice. The room was a good size and very comfortable. The lobby has a nice sitting area with a big screen TV (which was great for watching the late games after the Penn State game). Free breakfast in the morning was nice, but the cooked food was pretty bad. Stick to the cereal and you'll be happier.
reviews.title: New, clean, nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking for a place to stop over en route to our final destination. This hotel is clean, comfortable, and convenient to I-99. Hotel staff were very pleasant. Next door is Otto's microbrewery, a great place to recover from a day of driving. We will be staying here again
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, convenient

reviews.text: We were very happy with the hotel. It's clean, comfortable, and the staff people we met were very efficient and friendly. The bed was great.
reviews.title: Really nice hotel.

reviews.text: I'd like to give it five stars, but one thing bothered me about this hotel: The use of styrofoam plates and cups at breakfast. I would have like to see the hotel be a little "greener."
reviews.title: A good night

reviews.text: We stayed here one night at the end of semester at PSU. The hotel is clean and comfortable but doesn't get a top rating for a few items: the beds were only doubles and the towels were on the thin side. Still it is a nice hotel and I would definitely stay here again. I belong to the Marriott Honored Guest Awards program and appreciate the options available in the State College area.
reviews.title: Great location, decent hotel

reviews.text: convenient to downtown state college. located next door to Otto's brewpub. nice place for dinner and a beer. Fairfield provides a very extensive free breakfast including eggs, sausage, cold cereals, juices, bagels etc. Cost of a nights stay very reasonable. I recc this hotel
reviews.title: great breakfast!

reviews.text: I really appreciate the attention to detail that this hotel has shown every time I've stayed with them. Perhaps preferred status causes some extra attention to detail. If so, I'm pleased with the results regarding my room and bedding preferences. I'm often greeted by name and upgrades are provided when available. The rooms in State College are immaculate and the work space in their rooms very adequate. The breakfast area is always clean and well stocked. The coffee is good. Within the Marriott family, the Fairfield Inn brand has climbed substantially in quality and care. This facility and its staff are a real tribute to and an example for the service industry. I wish every hotel was as accommodating.
reviews.title: For the frequent traveler

reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights on business. Hotel is clean. They gym is decent, but lacks dumbells and a bench. Instead, they have a universal machine which is generally worthless and space consuming. Unfortunately, I got a room on the second floor, with a heavy lead foot upstairs. I asked to change rooms to something more quiet, but they did not have options available and were not very accomodating, which does not make sense since the place looks deserted. Probably will not be back.
reviews.title: ok with a few issues

reviews.text: The hotel itself is not bad. It was clean and the rooms were okay although the beds are not the most comfortable in the world. The free breakfast was very basic but does the trip. It is in a great location for PSU based activities. However, the price for graduation weekend was absolutely insane. I realize that there is price gouging and obviously there a lot of people in the area who NEED a room for graduation weekend, but $500+ for an extremely basic hotel is absolutely insane. The value does not even come remotely close to what you get.
reviews.title: Insanely Expensive Penn State Graduation Hotel

reviews.text: A very nice stay all around. The hotel is located only a couple miles outside of downtown State College. The staff was very friendly upon check-in and check-out. The room and bed were very comfortable. Your standard breakfast fare each morning. For the price, I don't know that it can be beat. There is a brew pub right next door if you are looking for something to eat. Easy to drive to a Wegman's, Trader Joe's and a bunch of other restaurants and stores. Will definitely be my stop over when I am back in State College.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel and good location

reviews.text: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Fairfield Inn in State College. I was pleasantly surprised by how nice the hotel is. They have a very welcoming lobby with a fireplace, comfy seating, and an area for breakfast. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The rooms were very nice although not as quiet as if you stayed in a full sized Marriott. The free breakfast included eggs, bacon, waffles, yogurt, bagels and pastries. This is much more than offered at some hotels at the same price point. I highly recommend that you consider staying at the Fairfield Inn if you are visiting State College.
reviews.title: Fairfield Inn offers nice rooms and good value in State College

reviews.text: We stayed at the Fairfield Inn when we were in town for a family funeral. The staff was helpful, the rooms were clean, and quiet, and they let us check in early. Free Wall Street Journals to read while we had our breakfast morning were a great touch.There's a Trader Joe's down the street and a Chick Fila across the street. Otto's next door is a great pub, too.
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.text: For the past 4 years, the Fairfield Inn has been my "go to" hotel for visits to Penn State. The hotel is a little off the beaten path, but it is new, and clean and has free breakfast and wi-fi. I have stayed in the 1 bedroom suite (very nice), A KING room and a standard double. The staff is friendly and willing to help. It does get quite crowded during Penn State athletic games and sometimes runs out of food at the breakfast buffet. My only complaint is that they do practice price gouging during graduation weekend and football weekends charging over $500 in some cases for a single night when at other times the same room is $99. For loyal Marriott customers this is unacceptable and now when my daughter graduates I will be staying at the Quality Inn.!!!!
reviews.title: Move Day at PSU

reviews.text: We stayed here for Penn State family weekend. Like every hotel in the area, the prices are jacked up to beyond reasonable. Rooms here are average..nothing special. Breakfast is good...I'll fitting lids for the to-go coffee caused a hot coffee spill on someone wearing shorts. The staff seemed unconcerned about it...Overall, not a bad place.
reviews.title: Nice place, pricey price!
